briefing.opening: Good morning/afternoon. We will now begin the climate briefing for January 15, 2026.

sections.title: ğŸ”´ Intensification of the Climate Crisis and its Severe Impacts
sections.content: Several studies and reports released today once again warn of the severity of the climate crisis and its widespread impacts. Domestically, a grim forecast suggests that if climate change is left unaddressed, half of Seoul's plant species could disappear by 2100 [1], and internationally, ocean damage has been shown to almost double the economic costs of climate change [36, 38]. 2025 was the third warmest year on record [37], with record-breaking heatwaves occurring in some regions, sounding an alarm about long-term global warming [46, 61, 74]. Climate change is projected to reduce U.S. income by up to 12% [39, 45], exacerbate nutritional disparities [41], and trigger global anomalous climate phenomena such as North Pacific storms, Alaskan glacier retreat, and California droughts [63, 67]. Furthermore, research suggesting that climate change likely played a role in the collapse of the Tang Dynasty [43] reminds us of the importance of climate through historical examples.

sections.title: ğŸŒ± Domestic Carbon Neutrality and Green Transition Efforts
sections.content: Domestically, diverse efforts for carbon neutrality and green transition are actively underway. The legislative activities of Provincial Assemblyman Heo Dong-won in response to climate change are drawing attention [2], and Wonju City is strengthening community-level preparedness and education by completing its final report on urban climate change disaster vulnerability analysis and operating carbon neutrality experience programs during winter vacation [4, 6]. Geoje City is promoting simultaneous enrollment in the Carbon Neutrality Point System when applying for zero-emission vehicle subsidies, encouraging citizen participation [5, 15, 20, 23], and Haenam County's Resource Circulation Complex Center has emerged as a carbon-neutral living hub, attracting 20,000 visitors annually [7, 18]. Various organizations, including Incheon City and Hoseo University's RISE Project Group, are exploring citizen action strategies and public-private partnerships for leading carbon-neutral cities [8, 9, 10, 12, 13, 24]. Alongside calls for proactive carbon-neutral investment from the industry, Hankook Tire has fulfilled its corporate responsibility by achieving a CDP Climate Change A rating for two consecutive years [11, 62]. Thus, the government, local authorities, industry, and civil society are all actively working towards achieving carbon neutrality [16, 17, 19, 21, 22, 34], and notably, hybrid vehicles significantly contributed to last year's record-high automobile export figures, showing a positive signal for the transition to eco-friendly vehicles [35].

sections.title: âš¡ Renewable Energy Expansion and Technology Innovation Trends
sections.content: The expansion of renewable energy and technological innovation are emerging as key drivers in responding to the climate crisis. The Geum River Basin Environmental Office signed an MOU to accelerate renewable energy dissemination to strengthen climate crisis response [27], and the Korea Rural Community Corporation is exploring models that involve local communities, such as promoting resident-participatory renewable energy projects [28]. Furthermore, the necessity for policy support is being emphasized, with 20 domestic renewable energy-related organizations convening to initiate legal and institutional improvements [29], and over 38,000 village solar power systems have already been installed, contributing to energy security [30]. KEPCO E&C is targeting the global wind power market and strengthening its cooperation network [31, 33], and Uijeongbu City's sewage treatment plant is being transformed into an eco-friendly energy complex and revenue-generating facility, demonstrating diversified infrastructure utilization [32]. Internationally, Google is making efforts to mitigate the impacts of climate change through physics and AI [54], and in the UK, a record-breaking auction for offshore wind power capacity demonstrated a strong commitment to clean energy transition [77]. However, challenges such as the frenzy over the relocation of Yongin semiconductor facilities due to a lack of understanding of renewable energy [25] and delays in India's clean energy industry [78] still remain to be addressed.

sections.title: ğŸŒ International Climate Science Discussions and Policy Challenges
sections.content: The international community continues discussions to deepen scientific understanding of climate change and address complex policy challenges. A report was presented on how the state of climate change and energy science has evolved over the past year [40], and the role of experts is becoming increasingly important, with a UCSB professor selected as a co-author for the 7th IPCC Climate Change Mitigation Assessment Report [49]. However, opinions from insiders wishing to discontinue the use of the term 'climate change' [42] and instances where NASA published global temperature data without mentioning 'climate change' [52] suggest difficulties in climate communication. Meanwhile, the pervasive impacts of climate change on daily life are being analyzed, with attention drawn to how it changes people's travel patterns [53] and its links to mental health [44]. The point that climate adaptation and resilience must consider context and culture [58], and research showing that societies have historically been able to adapt to changing climate conditions [71], provide implications for future response directions. Research indicating that Zimbabwe's land reform is helping small-scale farmers adapt to climate change [73] demonstrates the importance of locally-based adaptation efforts, but the increase in hate speech targeting Spanish meteorologists [75] and criticism of the Trump administration's 'embrace of ignorance' regarding climate science [76] reveal that social conflicts over climate science and policy still persist.

briefing.closing: Today's briefing highlighted both the severe reality of the climate crisis and the diverse domestic and international efforts to overcome it. This is a critical moment where listening to the warnings of the crisis and fostering practice and cooperation for a sustainable future are more urgent than ever. This concludes today's climate briefing.
